resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: January 25, 1862. The location, quite respectable otherwise, where the adventures of this book will unfold, truly existed in Paris at the time of the events we narrate. However, for reasons that the author may have the opportunity to explain later, it is appropriate, in this year 1861 where we find ourselves, that this reality be veiled. Therefore, the reader will understand that from now on, we will relocate it a bit by omitting the street names and indications that could reveal the district. (Move the thing to the Saint-Antoine district.) (Make alterations of this nature only on the copy.)
resource.chars: January 25, 1862. The location, quite respectable otherwise, where the adventures of this book will unfold, truly existed in Paris at the time of the events we narrate. However, for reasons that the author may have the opportunity to explain later, it is appropriate, in this year 1861 where we find ourselves, that this reality be veiled. Therefore, the reader will understand that from now on, we will relocate it a bit by omitting the street names and indications that could reveal the district. (Move the thing to the Saint-Antoine district.) (Make alterations of this nature only on the copy.)

item.value: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" d="M961.67879,572.53514h628.98027v0h628.98027v1150.07028v1150.07028h-628.98027h-628.98027v-1150.07028z" data-paper-data="{"strokeWidth":1,"rotation":0,"annotation":null,"nonHoverStrokeColor":["Color",0,0.74902,1],"editable":true}" id="rectangle_b4db6453-c164-43d4-bd3c-1724cd72179c" fill-opacity="0.00001" fill="#00bfff" fill-rule="nonzero" stroke="#00bfff" stroke-width="26.72256" stroke-linecap="butt" stroke-linejoin="miter" stroke-miterlimit="10" stroke-dasharray="" stroke-dashoffset="0" font-family="none" font-weight="none" font-size="none" text-anchor="none" style="mix-blend-mode: normal"/></svg>

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: It even happens that the manuscript explicitly anticipates a text to be published different from the manuscript. Here, for example (beginning of the Book V : À chasse noire, meute muette), Hugo decided that given the regime and possible annoyances, he had to move the convent, change its name, and imaginatively relocate it to the Saint-Antoine district. The new copy consists of sixty sheets and is placed at the end of the manuscripts. Everything happens as if he had anticipated a change of regime that would have allowed him to de-anonymize the locations.
resource.chars: It even happens that the manuscript explicitly anticipates a text to be published different from the manuscript. Here, for example (beginning of the Book V : À chasse noire, meute muette), Hugo decided that given the regime and possible annoyances, he had to move the convent, change its name, and imaginatively relocate it to the Saint-Antoine district. The new copy consists of sixty sheets and is placed at the end of the manuscripts. Everything happens as if he had anticipated a change of regime that would have allowed him to de-anonymize the locations.
